snippet: It is these voices of ambivalence that policy makers say are likely to be drowned out by the passion at the extreme ends.
abstract: Researchers and social scientists are beginning to study the large number of conflicted gun owners as potentially moderating influence in escalating gun control debate; policy makers say these voices of ambivalence are likely to be drowned out by the passion at the extreme ends of debate.
lead_paragraph: It is these voices of ambivalence that policy makers say are likely to be drowned out by the passion at the extreme ends.

headline.seo: Gun Owners Aren’t Always Gun Lovers
headline.main: For Some, Owning Guns Doesn’t Necessarily Mean Liking Them
headline.print_headline: For Some, Owning Guns Doesn’t Necessarily Mean Liking Them
